apis.name: New issue
apis.description: Creates a new project issue.

attributes.name: assignee_id
attributes.description: The ID of the user to assign the issue to. Only appears on GitLab Free.

attributes.name: assignee_ids
attributes.description: The IDs of the users to assign the issue to.

attributes.name: confidential
attributes.description: Set an issue to be confidential. Default is false.

attributes.name: created_at
attributes.description: When the issue was created. Date time string, ISO 8601 formatted, for example 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z. Requires administrator or project/group owner rights.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The description of an issue. Limited to 1,048,576 characters.

attributes.name: discussion_to_resolve
attributes.description: The ID of a discussion to resolve. This fills out the issue with a default description and mark the discussion as resolved. Use in combination with merge_request_to_resolve_discussions_of.

attributes.name: due_date
attributes.description: The due date. Date time string in the format YYYY-MM-DD, for example 2016-03-11

attributes.name: epic_id
attributes.description: ID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

attributes.name: epic_iid
attributes.description: IID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0. (deprecated, scheduled for removal in API version 5)

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of the project’s issue (requires administrator or project owner rights)

attributes.name: issue_type
attributes.description: The type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case. Default is issue.

attributes.name: labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated label names for an issue

attributes.name: merge_request_to_resolve_discussions_of
attributes.description: The IID of a merge request in which to resolve all issues. This fills out the issue with a default description and mark all discussions as resolved. When passing a description or title, these values take precedence over the default values.

attributes.name: milestone_id
attributes.description: The global ID of a milestone to assign issue. To find the milestone_id associated with a milestone, view an issue with the milestone assigned and use the API to retrieve the issue’s details.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The title of an issue

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: The weight of the issue. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

apis.name: Edit issue
apis.description: Updates an existing project issue. This call is also used to mark an issue as closed.

attributes.name: add_labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated label names to add to an issue.

attributes.name: assignee_ids
attributes.description: The ID of the user(s) to assign the issue to. Set to 0 or provide an empty value to unassign all assignees.

attributes.name: confidential
attributes.description: Updates an issue to be confidential

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The description of an issue. Limited to 1,048,576 characters.

attributes.name: discussion_locked
attributes.description: Flag indicating if the issue’s discussion is locked. If the discussion is locked only project members can add or edit comments.

attributes.name: due_date
attributes.description: The due date. Date time string in the format YYYY-MM-DD, for example 2016-03-11

attributes.name: epic_id
attributes.description: ID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

attributes.name: epic_iid
attributes.description: IID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0. (deprecated, scheduled for removal in API version 5)

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

attributes.name: issue_type
attributes.description: Updates the type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case.

attributes.name: labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated label names for an issue. Set to an empty string to unassign all labels.

attributes.name: milestone_id
attributes.description: The global ID of a milestone to assign the issue to. Set to 0 or provide an empty value to unassign a milestone.

attributes.name: remove_labels
attributes.description: Comma-separated label names to remove from an issue.

attributes.name: state_event
attributes.description: The state event of an issue. Set close to close the issue and reopen to reopen it

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The title of an issue

attributes.name: updated_at
attributes.description: When the issue was updated. Date time string, ISO 8601 formatted, for example 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z (requires administrator or project owner rights). Empty string or null values are not accepted.

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: The weight of the issue. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0. 0

apis.name: Delete an issue
apis.description: Only for administrators and project owners. Deletes an issue.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

apis.name: Reorder an issue
apis.description: Reorders an issue, you can see the results when sorting issues manually

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of the project’s issue

attributes.name: move_after_id
attributes.description: The ID of a project’s issue that should be placed after this issue

attributes.name: move_before_id
attributes.description: The ID of a project’s issue that should be placed before this issue

apis.name: Move an issue
apis.description: Moves an issue to a different project. If the target project is the source project or the user has insufficient permissions, an error message with status code 400 is returned.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

attributes.name: to_project_id
attributes.description: The ID of the new project

response.title: Sit voluptas tempora quisquam aut doloribus et.

apis.name: Clone an issue
apis.description: Clone the issue to given project. If the user has insufficient permissions, an error message with status code 400 is returned.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user.

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: Internal ID of a project’s issue.

attributes.name: to_project_id
attributes.description: ID of the new project.

attributes.name: with_notes
attributes.description: Clone the issue with notes. Default is false.

apis.name: Subscribe to an issue
apis.description: Subscribes the authenticated user to an issue to receive notifications. If the user is already subscribed to the issue, the status code 304 is returned.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

response.title: Sit voluptas tempora quisquam aut doloribus et.

apis.name: Unsubscribe from an issue
apis.description: Unsubscribes the authenticated user from the issue to not receive notifications from it. If the user is not subscribed to the issue, the status code 304 is returned.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

attributes.name: issue_iid
attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

apis.name: Create a to-do item
apis.description: Manually creates a to-do item for the current user on an issue. If there already exists a to-do item for the user on that issue, status code 304 is returned.

apis.name: Promote an issue to an epic
apis.description: Promotes an issue to an epic by adding a comment with the /promote quick action.

attributes.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

attributes.name: body
attributes.description: The content of a note. Must contain /promote at the start of a new line.
